page.title: 16Local History.
page.content: Near the Montrose Road crossroads there is a large{standing stone}in a field and it is a very unusual one. Unlike the other stones in the area it is a Pre-historic stone and, therefore, has no carvings on it. It has, however, been noted in the archives of the Museum. In the corner of the Montreathmont Forest nearest the School several{ {Bronze Age}cists have been found. Other Bronze Age relics have been found in many places in the area. About 30 years ago a farmer turned up a vase when he was ploughing. When examined by experts it was found to have belonged to the{Beaker People. This now reposes in the Museum in Dundee.
